A frontend application that fetches all dynamic data via backend APIs
A backend API layer connecting to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
Contest announcement posting functionality with title, description, date, and location fields
Contest results display section showing participant names, scores, and rankings
Photo gallery section for showcasing contest photos with captions and upload dates
User registration form for signing up to participate in contests
Contest browsing page listing all upcoming and past contests with filtering options
Individual contest detail pages with full descriptions, schedules, and related media
Responsive web design with mint cream background and teal-colored UI elements
Authentication system for users to manage their contest registrations
Admin dashboard for managing contest content, results, and photo submissions
Search functionality to find contests by keyword, date range, or location
Real-time contest status updates indicating if contests are open, closed, or ongoing
Package.json configuration enabling `npm run install:all` for combined dependency installation
Concurrent development server startup using `npm run dev` for both frontend and backend
